titles.title: Deschutes Resources Conservancy Reauthorization Act of 1999
To reauthorize the participation of the Bureau of Reclamation in the Deschutes Resources Conservancy, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-712.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 397.

action.text: Mr. Walden moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1787.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 669.

term.name: Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 5/12/1999--Introduced. Deschutes Resources Conservancy Reauthorization Act of 1999 - Amends the Oregon Resource Conservation Act of 1996 to: (1) require the Bureau of Reclamation to pay up to $2 million during each of FY 2002 through 2006 for Deschutes Basin ecosystem restoration projects proposed by the Working Group (the Deschutes Resources Conservancy); and (2) authorize appropriations to carry out such projects.
